## Base class

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regionnodebase">RegionNodeBase&lt;Tr&gt;</a></>}>
A <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regionnode">RegionNode</a> represents a subregion or a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> that is part of a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a>. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regionnodebase/#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

A single entry single exit <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a>.

A <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a> is a connected subgraph of a control flow graph that has exactly two connections to the remaining graph. It can be used to analyze or optimize parts of the control flow graph.

A <em> simple <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a> </em> is connected to the remaining graph by just two edges. One edge entering the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a> and another one leaving the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a>.

An <em> extended <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a> </em> (or just <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a>) is a subgraph that can be transform into a simple <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a>. The transformation is done by adding BasicBlocks that merge several entry or exit edges so that after the merge just one entry and one exit edge exists.

The <em>Entry</em> of a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a> is the first <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> that is passed after entering the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a>. It is an element of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a>. The entry <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> dominates all BasicBlocks in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a>.

The <em>Exit</em> of a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a> is the first <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> that is passed after leaving the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a>. It is not an element of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a>. The exit <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a>, postdominates all BasicBlocks in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a>.

A <em> canonical <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a> </em> cannot be constructed by combining smaller Regions.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a> A is the <em>parent</em> of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a> B, if B is completely contained in A.

Two canonical Regions either do not intersect at all or one is the parent of the other.

The <em> Program Structure Tree</em> is a graph (V, E) where V is the set of Regions in the control flow graph and E is the <em>parent</em> relation of these Regions.

Example:



<CodeBlock>
/// A simple control flow graph, that contains two regions.
///
///        1
///       / |
///      2   |
///     / \\   3
///    4   5  |
///    |   |  |
///    6   7  8
///     \\  | /
///      \\ |/       Region A: 1 -&gt; 9 &#123;1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8&#125;
///        9        Region B: 2 -&gt; 9 &#123;2,4,5,6,7&#125;
/// </CodeBlock>

You can obtain more examples by either calling

<code> &quot;opt -passes=&#39;print&lt;regions&gt;&#39; anyprogram.ll&quot; </code> or <code> &quot;opt -view-regions-only anyprogram.ll&quot; </code>

on any LLVM file you are interested in.

The first call returns a textual representation of the program structure tree, the second one creates a graphical representation using graphviz.

Definition at line 252 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/regioninfo-h">RegionInfo.h</a>.

<MemberDefinition

Clear the cache for BB RegionNodes.

After calling this function the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> RegionNodes will be stored at different memory locations. RegionNodes obtained before this function is called are therefore not comparable to RegionNodes abtained afterwords.

<SectionDefinition>

## BasicBlock Iterators


These iterators iterate over all BasicBlocks that are contained in this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a>.

The iterator also iterates over BasicBlocks that are elements of a subregion of this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a>. It is therefore called a flat iterator.

<SectionDefinition>

## Element Iterators


These iterators iterate over all <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> and subregion RegionNodes that are direct children of this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a>.

It does not iterate over any RegionNodes that are also element of a subregion of this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a>.
